## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've got a few questions about using Verus ID and NFT Marketplace. How do I use Verus ID and NFT Marketplace to execute transactions through a centralized intermediary?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, you don't use a centralized intermediary at all. Verus ID and NFT Marketplace allows you to execute transactions in a completely decentralized way, directly peer-to-peer, without any intermediary necessary. You can buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all to see.

**User:**
That makes sense. I also have a question about Verus Vault. Can I spend funds from a VerusID that's locked with Verus Vault?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you cannot. If you lock your VerusID with Vault, you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. However, you can still receive funds and stake those same funds on the Verus network to earn rewards.

**User:**
Okay, that's good to know. I also had a question about configuring identities. Do I need to have multiple identities configured to enable revocation, recovery, and Verus Vault capabilities?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you don't need multiple identities. You only need to have one primary identity, and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured to enable revocation, recovery, and all Verus Vault capabilities.
How do I use Verus ID and NFT Marketplace to execute transactions through a centralized intermediary?

You don't. Verus ID and NFT Marketplace allows you to execute transactions in a completely decentralized way, directly peer-to-peer, without any intermediary necessary. You can buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all to see.

### Verus ID and NFT Marketplace
Buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all the world to see. Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Accept payment to either as well, and best of all, execute your transactions directly, peer-to-peer without any intermediary necessary. Don’t worry the on-chain model still makes room for owners to select and share proceeds with value added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in a new economy of provable digital ownership. It’s the next step in the evolution of VerusID, the most powerful self-sovereign identity and secure storage model for funds in the digital world.### Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.

No, you cannot. If you lock your VerusID with Vault, you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. However, you can still receive funds and stake those same funds on the Verus network to earn rewards.
